text: Basic Coconut Fudge Chop the white chocolate into small pieces. Melt over a low heat with the condensed milk for 7 to 10 minutes. Mix in the white sugar with an electric mixer.  Add in the desiccated coconut and the coconut flavouring. Mix well for at least three minutes. Pour the mixture into a lined 18cm x 18cm tin. Spread it out evenly with a spatula. Leave it to set in a fridge for 2- 4 hours. Once it has set, cut into squares and serve. Toasted Coconut Fudge Add the toasted coconut flakes into the blender cup. Pulse for about 40 seconds, starting slowly and gradually getting faster. Add vanilla extract and cacao butter. Pulse for about 45 seconds. Add the dollop of honey. Pulse for 10 seconds and slowly increase to high speed. Spray a pan with coconut oil to keep the flavour and pour the mixture into it. Put in the fridge to set for 2-4 hours. Cut into squares and serve. Make sure to keep it cool and fresh at all times. Creamy Coconut Fudge Grease an 8x8 inch pan with margarine.  Pour the sugar, condescend milk, coconut milk and margarine into a pot and let it simmer for 15 minutes.  Pour in the rest of the ingredients and let it simmer until it reaches the temperature of 110• c.  Pour the fudge into the pan and let it chill overnight. Enjoy! Finished.
